name: reportUsers
description:
A user is considered to be an active host during the month specified in the "from" and "to" range, if the user has hosted at least one meeting during this period. If the user didn't host any meetings during this period, the user is considered to be inactive.
The Active Hosts report displays a list of meetings, participants, and meeting minutes for a specific time range, up to one month. The month should fall within the last six months.
The Inactive Hosts report pulls a list of users who were not active during a specific period of time. Use this API to retrieve an active or inactive host report for a specified period of time. The time range for the report is limited to a month and the month should fall under the past six months.
You can specify the type of report and date range using the query parameters.
**Scopes:** `report:read:admin`
**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`
**Prerequisites:**
* Pro or higher plan.

type.description:
Active or inactive hosts.
`active` - Active hosts.
`inactive` - Inactive hosts.

from.description: Start date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range defined by the "from" and "to" parameters should only be one month as the report includes only one month worth of data at once.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

page_number.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.

next_page_token.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

$ul: **page_count**: The number of pages returned for the request made.
**page_number**: The page number of the current results. (default: 1)
**page_size**: The number of records returned with a single API call. (default: 30)
**total_records**: The total number of all the records available across pages.
**total_meeting_minutes**: Number of meeting minutes for this range.
**total_meetings**: Number of meetings for this range.
**total_participants**: Number of participants for this range.
